  • Math

Here are a few things I've written while learning math.

  • Characters in global equivariant homotopy theory (March 2015)
    My senior thesis, giving an exposition of the Hopkins-Kuhn-Ravenel character theory (and Stapleton's generalization), taking advantage of the language of global equivariant homotopy theory. In an ideal world this would have a been a polished, formal document, but it's really quite rough (unsurprisingly, the actual writing process ended up being rather concentrated around the due date). A cleaner version should (hopefully) appear in the (somewhat) near future.
  • Vector fields on spheres (May 2014)
    An exposition of the ideas in Adams's solution to the problem of finding vector fields on spheres, and its relation to his work on the J-homomorphism.
  • Defining the cotangent complex (Dec 2013)
    An exposition of Quillen's application of the theory of model categories to defining a homology theory of algebras in analogy with singular homology.
  • The Dold-Kan correspondence (Oct 2013)
    A proof of the titular result, and a couple of quick consequences.
